titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2181) to ensure the safety of witnesses and to promote notification of the interstate relocation of witnesses by States and localities engaging in that relocation, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-419, by Mr. Diaz-Balart.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2181 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be read by title. Bill is open to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 146.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 2/24/1998--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (open) for the consideration of H.R. 2181 (witness protection and relocation).
